revised_title: A New Register-Pyrometer for Measuring High Temperatures
tldr: The author, J. Frederic Daniell, developed a new register-pyrometer to measure the expansions of solids and determine higher degrees of temperature on the common thermometric scale. The device consists of a black-lead earthenware bar and a porcelain index, which moves forward as the metal bar expands due to heat. This invention aimed to improve upon previous temperature-measuring instruments and expand our knowledge of metal expansion.
